column3: apparently representing an even more primitive adjective *''barándâ'' (stem [[BARAT|BARÁD]]).

column2: march"<ref>{{HM|AF}}</ref>. The [[Hobbitish]] name [[Brandagamba]] (translated as [[Brandybuck]]) is derived from this word and the ending ''-gamba''. Though a better translation of the name would be "Marchbuck
column3: Tolkien translated it Brandybuck" in order to retain the connection with the [[Brandywine]] River.<ref>{{HM|AF}}</ref>

column1: Perhaps it comes from a possible [[Adûnaic]] *''barrad''
